context:
List of sports films
Title | Year | Genre | Notes
--- | --- | --- | ---
The Silver Horde | 1930 | Drama | Joel McCrea , a salmon fisherman , tries to open a cannery
Tiger Shark | 1932 | Drama | Fisherman Edward G. Robinson loses a hand saving a man 's life
Riffraff | 1936 | Romance | Tuna cannery worker Jean Harlow falls for fisherman Spencer Tracy
Captains Courageous | 1937 | Adventure | A spoiled brat ends up with the crew of a fishing schooner
Spawn of the North | 1938 | Drama | A seal hunter ( George Raft ) betrays a pal ( Henry Fonda ) , poaching fish
Johnny Frenchman | 1945 | Drama | British film about rival Cornwall fishing families
Tuna Clipper | 1949 | Drama | Roddy McDowall takes a job with a crew of tuna fishermen
Alaska Seas | 1954 | Drama | A remake of Spawn of the North , with Robert Ryan and Brian Keith
The Old Man and the Sea | 1958 | Adventure | After 84 days without a catch , a Cuban fisherman ( Spencer Tracy ) lands a marlin
Man 's Favorite Sport ? | 1964 | Comedy | A phony fishing expert ( Rock Hudson ) ends up entered in a big tournament
Blue Fin | 1978 | Family | Australian film about a boy who learns tuna fishing
A River Runs Through It | 1992 | Drama | Story of Montana brothers hooked on fly-fishing , directed by Robert Redford
Gone Fishin ' | 1997 | Comedy | Inept anglers Joe Pesci and Danny Glover have an adventure in the Everglades
Bait Shop | 2008 | Comedy | A bait shop owner enters a pro fishing tournament to save his store
The Lost World of Mr. Hardy | 2008 | Documentary | U.K. film about a family firm that manufactures fishing tackle
Ondine | 2009 | Drama | An Irish fisherman ( Colin Farrell ) catches a woman in his net
Salmon Fishing in the Yemen | 2011 | Comedy | A Brit ( Ewan McGregor ) helps a sheikh introduce salmon fishing to his country

wiki_section_title: Fishing

wiki_section_text: 

intro: This compilation of films covers all sports activities. Sports films have been made since the era of silent films, such as the 1915 film The Champion starring Charlie Chaplin. Films in this genre can range from serious (Raging Bull) to silly (Horse Feathers). A classic theme for sports films is the triumph of an individual or team who prevail despite the difficulties, standard elements of melodrama.

qa.question: Who was the director of the 1949 fishing sports movie featuring Roddy McDowall ?

ott_1411_1.Query Analysis: The query is asking for the name of the director of a specific movie that was released in 1949 and features Roddy McDowall. The movie is related to fishing sports.
ott_1411_1.Query Keywords Extraction: director, 1949, fishing sports movie, Roddy McDowall
ott_1411_1.Answer Analysis: The answer is William Beaudine, indicating he was the director of the movie in question.
ott_1411_1.Document Content Analysis: The document lists various films related to fishing, along with their release years, genres, and brief descriptions. It also includes an introductory section about sports films in general.

ott_1411_1.Key Information Matching: The document focuses on fishing-related movies but none of the listed films match the year 1949 or mention Roddy McDowall.
ott_1411_1.Can the Document Answer the Query: No, the document does not contain information about the specific 1949 fishing sports movie featuring Roddy McDowall.
ott_1411_1.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: No, the document does not provide any context or additional information that could help infer the director of the specific movie in question.
ott_1411_1.Explanation: The document is irrelevant to the query as it does not provide any information about the specific 1949 fishing sports movie featuring Roddy McDowall, nor does it mention the director William Beaudine. The document focuses on other fishing-related movies from different years and does not help in answering the query or providing useful context.
